page.title: 13GAMES PEOPLE PLAY
page.content: TWO OF THE GAMES PLAYED BETWEEN OUR NEXT DOOR NEIGHBOURS AND OURSELVES ARE CALLED BRITISH BULLDOGS AND SARDINES.IN BRITISH BULLDOGS WE SELECT A PERSON WHO MUST CATCH THE RUNNERS. THE CATCHER CHOOSES A SET THING SUCH AS 'TREES',AND THE RUNNERS MUST THEN THINK OF THE NAME OF A TREE.IF THE CATCHER GUESSES THE NAME THE RUNNER MUST RUN.IF HE IS CAUGHT HE IS THE CATCHER IN THE NEXT GAME. IN THE GAME OF SARDINES ONE PERSON IS SELECTED TO GO AND HIDE ANYWHERE.THE SEEKERS COUNT UP TO A CERTAIN NUMBER. WHEN EVERY COUNTER HAS FINISHED COUNTING THEY GO TO TRY AND FIND THE PERSON WHO IS HIDING.EVERYONE HAS TO SPLIT UP SO THAT THE HIDER IS NOT FOUND AT ONCE.WHEN THE HIDER IS FOUND THE SEEKER HAS TO WAIT WITH THE HIDER UNTIL EVERYONE ELSE HAS COME.THIS SEEKER IS THE HIDER IN THE NEXT GAME.
